definitions: the state or quality of having opposite surfaces or sides close together

examples.text: the thinness of the line between tolerance and blackmail

shortDefinitions: state or quality of having opposite surfaces or sides that are close together

definitions: the quality of being made of light material
shortDefinitions: quality of being made of light material

definitions: the state or quality of having little, or too little, flesh or fat on the body

examples.text: the pitiful thinness of his body

shortDefinitions: state or quality of having little, or too little, flesh or fat on body

definitions: the state of having few parts or people relative to the area covered or filled
shortDefinitions: state of having few parts or people relative to area

definitions: the quality of air containing less oxygen than normal

examples.text: the thinness of the atmosphere at such extreme altitudes

definitions: the quality of a liquid substance not containing much solid

examples.text: the relative thinness of water compared with silicone gel

shortDefinitions: quality of liquid not containing much solid

definitions: lack of substance or quality; weakness

examples.text: there's enough action to camouflage the thinness of the plot
